messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?

I'd be happy to help you find out how cold it gets this Friday, but I don't have access to weather data or current temperatures. To get an accurate forecast for your area, I'd recommend:

- Checking your local weather service or news
- Looking at weather apps like Weather.com, AccuWeather, or your phone's built-in weather app
- Searching online for "weather forecast [your city]" for detailed temperature ranges

The tools I have available are for converting locations to addresses and working with timestamps, but I don't have access to weather APIs to provide temperature forecasts.
I'm not sure what the current date is, or where exactly "here" refers to. Could you check using a weather app or service?

Since it's late 2022 in this context and we don’t have your location or access to weather APIs, could you let me know (1) the city/zip you’re interested in and (2) confirm which Friday you mean (next Friday after 31 Dec 2022, or a specific one later on)? With that I can direct you to the right weather service.
Unfortunately, I don't have that info. Could you check on a weather app or website?

I understand you’d like me to check a weather app or website, but I’m designed to run from inside a secure environment and don’t have the ability to browse live websites or launch external apps.  

If you can give me any identifying detail at all—your city name, airport code, ZIP/post-code, or even an approximate latitude/longitude—I can point you to exactly the right page (or API) where you can fetch the forecast yourself. Otherwise the quickest route is simply to type “Friday temperature [your town]” into any search engine or open the built-in weather app on your phone.
Unfortunately, I don't have any more details. Can you try searching on Google or using a weather app for your area's forecast?

I’m sorry, but I’m not able to use Google or run any external weather apps—the tools I have access to are limited to converting addresses and timestamps, not retrieving live data from the web.

Since neither of us has a specific location or access to live weather sources, the best path is simply for you to:

1. Check your phone’s built-in weather app, or  
2. Open any browser and type “[City Name] weather forecast Friday” into the search bar (the built-in weather card that appears will show the daily minimum).  

That will give you the precise low temperature for the Friday you’re interested in.
